pr_title: DBZ-1725 fix broken images in documentation

timeline.message: DBZ-1725 imagesdir already provided by Antora, shouldn't be set manually
DBZ-1725 don't override attributes when running Antora
DBZ-1725 Use AsciiDoc headings instead of Markdown headings for consistency

timeline.bodyText: This is probably the only change I see that may raise a concern, particularly for downstream consumption of the docs as I understand the _attributes.adoc file isn't consumed by that build process; so this might introduce a small incompatibility with downstream.  @fbolton can you let us know if this breaks something downstream as time permits?  If it does, perhaps we can find a better way to handle this for you guy.  From our perspective, this change is perfectly fine so I think we can live with it for now and let the downstream docs guys get back to us and we make further changes as we find are needed.
timeline.author: Naros

replies.bodyText: IIRC, @fbolton also was advocating for removing those attributes from individual files to avoid the redundancy.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: To solve it in the source, one could use ifdef macros. If this is a common attribute downstream, it could be for example a command line argument it is uses plain Asciidoctor.
replies.author: ahus1
